name: Radar & Sensing
description: Sector template for radar, positioning, and sensing patents including GPS/GNSS, LIDAR, radar signal processing, and location technologies.
contextDescription: Radar and sensing patents cover technologies for positioning, detection, and environmental sensing. Key areas include GPS/GNSS receivers, LIDAR, automotive radar, gesture sensing, and proximity detection. Targets include automotive suppliers, consumer electronics OEMs, and industrial equipment manufacturers.
scoringGuidance: Automotive radar patents (77GHz) are high value as ADAS adoption accelerates.
GNSS multi-constellation patents (GPS + Galileo + GLONASS + BeiDou) have broader applicability.
Indoor positioning patents address the challenging GPS-denied environments.
Gesture sensing patents target consumer electronics and automotive HMI.
Fusion patents (radar + camera + LIDAR) are strategically valuable for autonomous vehicles.

questions.question: What sensing technology does this patent address? Score 1-3 for single modality (GPS only), 4-6 for enhanced single modality, 7-10 for multi-modal or sensor fusion.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify sensing modality: GPS/GNSS, radar, LIDAR, ultrasonic, camera, fusion.

questions.question: Is this patent applicable to automotive sensing (ADAS, autonomous driving)? Score 1-3 if not automotive, 4-6 for general automotive sensing, 7-10 for ADAS-critical or autonomous vehicle.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Automotive sensing is a high-growth market. Assess ADAS/AV applicability.

questions.question: What level of accuracy does this patent enable? Score 1-3 for basic (meters), 4-6 for enhanced (sub-meter), 7-10 for high-precision (centimeter or better).
questions.reasoningPrompt: High-accuracy positioning enables RTK, autonomous vehicles, and industrial applications.

questions.question: How robust is the sensing in challenging environments? Score 1-3 for ideal conditions only, 4-6 for moderate robustness, 7-10 for all-weather/GPS-denied/multipath-resistant.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Robustness to weather, multipath, and interference is critical for reliability.

questions.question: What signal processing innovations does this patent introduce? Consider: waveform design, interference mitigation, target detection/tracking algorithms.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify signal processing techniques: FMCW, pulse compression, CFAR, tracking filters.
